marklogic.body: Yes I have, BUT very specific circumstances: only after they were 3 years old (could undo their own belts and open doors), only when the weather is mild (not Too hot or Cold), alarm set (so if they open the door it honks) and I am within direct close view of the car. Example: picking up Chris from elementary school, I would leave Jonny in his booster seat with the doors locked (he can open from inside if he needed me) if it was raining and I was standing 50 feet away, watching him the whole time. I also leave my kids (8 and 5) in the locked car if I forget something in the house and have to run just inside the door. Its not like I'm leaving them unattended, even though they are in a car and I'm outside, since I can Reach them in less than 5 seconds. I wouldn't leave them in the car to go into any store (except to pay for gas)
